intro: Laurembergia hirsuta var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hirsute laurembergia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of red and orange, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
